introduction: Welcome to the second topic in the Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) series, focusing on computer graphics. This lecture will introduce the fundamental concepts of computer graphics, covering topics such as modeling, rendering, and viewing. We will discuss the different components of a computer graphics system, including input and output devices, graphic systems, application programs, and application models. The lecture will also cover the framework for interacting with graphics and how computer graphics have evolved from input devices to output devices. By the end of this session, you will have a solid understanding of the fundamentals of computer graphics and their applications in various fields.

sections.title: Section 1: Fundamentals of Computer Graphics
content: Computer graphics is the use of computers to create and manipulate pictures on a display device.
The main disciplines contributing to HCI include computer science, computer graphics, and user interface design.
Computer graphics comprises software techniques for creating, storing, and manipulating images, such as EPS, CGM, PDF, and SVG.
Computer graphics can be used for various applications, including computer art, architectural drawing, game design, education, and specialized system design.

sections.title: Section 2: Components of a Computer Graphics System
content: A computer graphics system consists of input and output devices, graphic systems, application programs, and application models.
Input devices, such as a mouse or a touch screen, allow users to interact with the system.
Output devices, such as a monitor or a projector, display the graphics.
Graphic systems, such as OpenGL or DirectX, manage the rendering process.
Application programs, such as Photoshop or Blender, provide tools for creating and manipulating graphics.

sections.title: Section 3: Modeling, Rendering, and Viewing
content: Modeling involves defining objects in terms of primitives, coordinates, and characteristic modeling.
Rendering applies physical-based procedures to generate photorealistic images from scenes using lighting and shading.
Viewing discusses displaying images from various viewpoints on various devices.
Modeling, rendering, and viewing are essential components of a computer graphics system.

sections.title: Section 4: Framework for Interacting with Graphics
content: Computer graphics have evolved from input devices to output devices, allowing for more complex and interactive applications.
The framework for interacting with graphics includes understanding user needs, designing intuitive interfaces, and implementing efficient algorithms.
Computer graphics have numerous applications in various fields, such as game design, education, and specialized system design.
Effective use of computer graphics requires a deep understanding of the underlying principles and techniques.

sections.title: Section 5: Applications of Computer Graphics
content: Computer graphics have numerous applications in various fields, such as game design, education, and specialized system design.
Computer graphics can be used to create realistic simulations, visualize complex data, and enhance user experiences.
Computer graphics have played a crucial role in advancing fields like medicine, engineering, and entertainment.
The applications of computer graphics are constantly evolving, requiring continuous learning and adaptation.
